metadata.synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. After player talks to Father Carrion and has been tasked to kill them, they will react to this and either run to warn their leader, Thrumbo, or confront player. The following states are one-liners and hasmets for each possible quest state (meeting with thrumbo, outside house and inside father carrion's house once fully killed.)
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to LumbarLocation: CTY_Main_A Initial: 86; 41; -69Meeting: 66; 1; -120Outside house: -8; 11; -145Inside house: 1; 8; -157

2.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
2.text: Back for more? I don't mind, so long as you're paying. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

8.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
8.text: I told you all I know. Now go and find him, before you get me in trouble.

17.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
17.text: Think Carrion's corpse would make a good punching bag?

21.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
21.text: Find the boats, you'll find Thrumbo. That's all I know!

22.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
22.text: Changed your mind? Offer's still there. Go on - have a swing. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

32.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
32.text: I'll make sure no one harms us again. Keep training, keep fighting.

41.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
41.text: Come to have a go? Give it your best shot.

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*

80.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
80.text: Gold first. Then you can hit me. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Isn't this cheating if you're already dead?

81.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
81.text: I'm not dead. Just got a bit of nerve damage. So, you having a go or not? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You ran away from Mystic Carrion to do this?

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'm looking for Thrumbo. Mystic Carrion wants him home.

31.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
31.text: Don't think about trying anything. I'll fight back.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises his fists, nervous but ready for a fightNodeContext: Shouted to friends in the distance

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Relax, the boss just wanted to give you and Thrumbo a proper send off. Does you need anything?

53.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
53.text: He did? I suppose, I mean - really?
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing from fists up pose into normal standing stanceNodeContext: Utter disbelief

54.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
54.text: No chance. I'm not telling you a thing.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Carrion means Thrumbo no harm. He sent me with provisions for his journey.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Unless you want me to purge this realm of you and your undead brothers, you'll talk.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Either you tell me where Thrumbo is, or I drive my fist through your skull.

28.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
28.text: Bloody hells. And I thought Carrion was a bastard.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Going from his fists up pose to flinching, then relaxing into a regular standing postureNodeContext: Shocked at how violent the threat was, almost impressed

38.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
38.text: Thrumbo was going to get us a boat. But I haven't heard from him since.
38.context: NodeContext: Struggling to remember, hard to tell if he's making a joke at his own (zombie) expense

44.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
44.text: He must be somewhere near the water. I just hope he didn't drown.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Tell me where Thrumbo is, and it'll be like we never met.

71.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
71.text: I suppose that's all right. Thrumbo's more of a talker than I am.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxing from fists up pose into normal standing stance

82.speaker: Player
82.text: A strange way to earn your keep. Do many take you up on this?

52.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
52.text: Plenty. Lots of angry people in this city. No one else to take it out on.

3.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
3.text: Go on. You seem like you've something pent up.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: That's a cheap price for allowing someone to beat you up.

56.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
56.text: Charge too much, people hit you harder. Then they take the gold back.

77.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
77.text: Besides, I've taken enough punches for free. Least this way I get paid something.
77.context: NodeContext: Small laugh - not clear if he's joking, 'something' as in it's not nothing

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Usually people pay me not to hit them.

43.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
43.text: Tried that once. They took the gold and hit me anyway.

62.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
62.text: Better this way. I still leave with gold in my pocket.

66.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
66.text: So, you having a go or not?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Of course I'm not going to hit you.

64.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
64.text: Then move. Let someone else have a go.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I can't afford it. How about giving me a free trial?

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Look closer. Try to identify the cause of the smell.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I hit very fast. Are you sure you're up to it?

20.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
20.text: S'not a flat fee - you pay per punch, mate. Faster you hit, faster I make coin.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

65.speaker: Player
65.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

4.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouted out towards his zombie brothers (not nearby, unseen)NodeContext: Shouted to friends in the distance

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*

51.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
51.text: Thrumbo said you saved us, so thanks, I guess. Doesn't mean you don't need some sense knocking into you.
51.context: NodeContext: Grumpy/surly - he was pissed off at you but is reluctantly getting over it

70.speaker: Strange Beggar Lumbar
70.text: Go away. I'm not telling you squat.
